item.title: Several methods to quickly reset a file to zero bytes
item.description: Overview # Sometimes, you may need to reset a file to zero bytes without deleting it, such as in the case of a log file that is actively being used. Methods # Use the truncate command with the -s 0 option, which specifies the size as zero bytes. truncate -s 0 <filename> Utilisez un espace réservé et un opérateur de redirection pour vider un fichier en l’écrasant. :> <filename>
